trans-unit.source: Evaluate Model
trans-unit.target: Evaluate Model

trans-unit.source: Evaluates the results of a classification or regression model with standard metrics
trans-unit.target: Evaluates the results of a classification or regression model with standard metrics

trans-unit.source: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="EA496474-D04C-474F-896F-3F4531CD8BE0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Machine Learning / Evaluate</legacyLink>
trans-unit.target: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="EA496474-D04C-474F-896F-3F4531CD8BE0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Machine Learning / Evaluate</legacyLink>

trans-unit.source: Module Overview
trans-unit.target: Module Overview

trans-unit.source: You can use <ui>Evaluate Model</ui> to measure the accuracy of a trained classification model or regression model.
trans-unit.target: You can use <ui>Evaluate Model</ui> to measure the accuracy of a trained classification model or regression model.

trans-unit.source: You provide a dataset containing scores generated from a trained model, and the <ui>Evaluate Model</ui> module computes a set of industry-standard evaluation metrics.
trans-unit.target: You provide a dataset containing scores generated from a trained model, and the <ui>Evaluate Model</ui> module computes a set of industry-standard evaluation metrics.

trans-unit.source: The metrics returned by <ui>Evaluate Model</ui> depend on the type of model that you are evaluating:
trans-unit.target: The metrics returned by <ui>Evaluate Model</ui> depend on the type of model that you are evaluating:

trans-unit.source: Classification models
trans-unit.target: Classification models

trans-unit.source: Accuracy, precision, recall, F-Score, AUC, average log loss, and training log loss metrics
trans-unit.target: Accuracy, precision, recall, F-Score, AUC, average log loss, and training log loss metrics

trans-unit.source: Regression models
trans-unit.target: Regression models

trans-unit.source: Mean absolute error, root mean squared error, relative absolute error, and relative squared error metrics
trans-unit.target: Mean absolute error, root mean squared error, relative absolute error, and relative squared error metrics

trans-unit.source: For definitions of these metrics, see <link xlink:href="ea496474-d04c-474f-896f-3f4531cd8be0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Evaluate</link>.
trans-unit.target: For definitions of these metrics, see <link xlink:href="ea496474-d04c-474f-896f-3f4531cd8be0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Evaluate</link>.

trans-unit.source: How to Use Evaluate Model
trans-unit.target: How to Use Evaluate Model

trans-unit.source: To evaluate a model, you must connect a dataset that contains a set of input columns and scores.
trans-unit.target: To evaluate a model, you must connect a dataset that contains a set of input columns and scores.

trans-unit.source: Typically, you connect the <ui>Scored dataset</ui> output of <link xlink:href="401b4f92-e724-4d5a-be81-d5b0ff9bdb33" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Score Model</link> to the input of <ui>Evaluate Model</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Typically, you connect the <ui>Scored dataset</ui> output of <link xlink:href="401b4f92-e724-4d5a-be81-d5b0ff9bdb33" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Score Model</link> to the input of <ui>Evaluate Model</ui>.

trans-unit.source: However, you can use any dataset that includes a score column.
trans-unit.target: However, you can use any dataset that includes a score column.

trans-unit.source: Optionally, you can connect a second set of scores to <ui>Evaluate Model</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Optionally, you can connect a second set of scores to <ui>Evaluate Model</ui>.

trans-unit.source: This feature is useful because you can easily compare results from two different models on the same data.
trans-unit.target: This feature is useful because you can easily compare results from two different models on the same data.

trans-unit.source: Or, you might compare scores from two different runs over the same data with different parameters.
trans-unit.target: Or, you might compare scores from two different runs over the same data with different parameters.

trans-unit.source: Examples
trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.source: For examples of how to generate, visualize, and interpret evaluation metrics, see these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For examples of how to generate, visualize, and interpret evaluation metrics, see these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: These experiments demonstrate how to build multiple models and use <ui>Evaluate Model</ui> to determine which model is the best.
trans-unit.target: These experiments demonstrate how to build multiple models and use <ui>Evaluate Model</ui> to determine which model is the best.

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Compare Binary Classifiers </linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525729</linkUri></externalLink> sample explains how to compare the performance of different classifiers that were built using the same data,
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Compare Binary Classifiers </linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525729</linkUri></externalLink> sample explains how to compare the performance of different classifiers that were built using the same data,

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Compare Multi-class Classifiers</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525730</linkUri></externalLink> sample demonstrates how to compare the accuracy of different classification models that were built on the letter recognition dataset.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Compare Multi-class Classifiers</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525730</linkUri></externalLink> sample demonstrates how to compare the accuracy of different classification models that were built on the letter recognition dataset.

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Compare Regressors</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525731</linkUri></externalLink> sample walks you through the process of evaluating different regression models.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Compare Regressors</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525731</linkUri></externalLink> sample walks you through the process of evaluating different regression models.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, see these sample experiments:
trans-unit.target: Additionally, see these sample experiments:

trans-unit.source: In the <externalLink><linkText>Demand estimation</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525271</linkUri></externalLink> sample, larn how to combine evaluation metrics from multiple models.
trans-unit.target: In the <externalLink><linkText>Demand estimation</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525271</linkUri></externalLink> sample, larn how to combine evaluation metrics from multiple models.

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Customer relationship prediction</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525941</linkUri></externalLink> sample demonstrates how to evaluate multiple related models.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Customer relationship prediction</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525941</linkUri></externalLink> sample demonstrates how to evaluate multiple related models.

trans-unit.source: Exceptions
trans-unit.target: Exceptions

trans-unit.source: Exception
trans-unit.target: Exception

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if one or more of inputs are null or empty.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if one or more of inputs are null or empty.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if passed to module learner has invalid type.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if passed to module learner has invalid type.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if number of columns in some of the datasets passed to the module is too small.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if number of columns in some of the datasets passed to the module is too small.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if number of rows in some of the datasets passed to the module is too small.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if number of rows in some of the datasets passed to the module is too small.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if dataset does not contain a label column.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if dataset does not contain a label column.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if dataset does not contain a score column.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if dataset does not contain a score column.
